summary.text: This viral short video masterfully employs anthropomorphism, casting a hamster as a beleaguered Korean office worker named 'Kim Hamjji' to depict the universally relatable tragedy of unexpected overtime. The narrative follows a classic comedic structure of rising hope followed by a crushing reality. It begins with the hamster's cheerful calculation to leave work on time, which is immediately shattered by a manager's last-minute assignment. The video then chronicles the hamster's descent into a late-night work session, fueled by grim determination and punctuated by moments of despair. The central climax occurs when, after hours of work, a critical file-saving error triggers a spectacular and hilarious meltdown, encapsulated by the raw Korean curse '지랄하지마!' (Don't fuck with me!). A brief recovery powered by an energy drink leads to a final, ironic punchline: the next day, it's revealed the manager who assigned the work was on vacation, rendering the entire ordeal absurdly pointless. The video's success hinges on its deep cultural resonance with Korean 'Yageun' (overtime) culture, the perfect comedic timing of its editing, and the highly expressive, soul-filled voice-over that transforms a cute animal meme into a poignant and hilarious commentary on corporate life.

analysis.text: The hook is exceptionally strong, establishing a highly relatable scenario within the first three seconds. It opens with the hamster character's internal monologue, calculating the end of a meeting and concluding with the hopeful thought of '퇴근' (going home). This immediately connects with any viewer who has experienced the anticipation of leaving work. The combination of a cute, anthropomorphized hamster (visual), a high-pitched, hopeful voice (audio), and a universally understood narrative goal creates an instant emotional investment and sets up the subsequent expectation subversion.

The audience reaction is overwhelmingly positive, marked by widespread amusement and deep empathy. Viewers consistently highlight the video's painful relatability to their own experiences with Korean office culture, particularly the dreaded 'yageun' (overtime). The dubbing is a focal point of praise, with the hamster's desperate scream of '지랄하지마!' (a strong Korean curse) being lauded for its 'soulful' and authentic delivery, capturing a frustration many feel but cannot express. The comment section is filled with users sharing their own overtime horror stories, creating a strong sense of community and shared catharsis. The blend of cute visuals with raw, realistic emotional expression is the core driver of its viral appeal.

notable_comments.translation_en: The 'Don't fuck with me' is some real soul-filled dubbing lolllll
What the heck is 'FUCKEN hae' [do the FUCKEN] lolll
The fact that the team leader was on annual leave at the end is so freaking infuriating lol

audience_reaction.overall_sentiment: Overwhelmingly positive, hilarious, and deeply relatable

asr_transcript.text: [햄스터] 아.. 회의 끝나니까 6시. 그렇다면 퇴근. [팀장] 햄찌씨, 회의에서 나온 리서치 건 내일 중으로 한번 보자! [햄스터] 넵! (자동 반사) 그렇다면.. 야근. 추.. (체념의 주문) 어.. 눈 뻐근해. 무슨 일이 있어도 9시엔 퇴근한다. [시계 소리] 진짜.. 이제 다 했어. 저장! [에러 소리] ...? 아! 야! 아! ㅈㅣ랄하지마!!! ㅈㅣ랄하지마!!!!!! ㅈㅣ랄하지마!!!! ... 다.. 끝이다.. 모오와리.. 안돼 안돼. 정신차렷!!!!!!!!!! 붙잡아!!!!!!!!!! [캔 따는 소리, 마시는 소리] 끄어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어어- 마지막 저장은 1시간 전.. 세상이 암만 억까해도 결국 해내야 한다. [음악] 안녕하세요.. [동료] 허억. 햄찌씨... 어제 야근했다며? [햄스터] 아 네.. 오늘 팀장님이랑 볼 게 있어가지구요.. [동료] 어억?! 오늘 팀장님 연차인데? 몰랐어?
asr_transcript.translation_en: [Hamster] Ah.. the meeting ends, so it's 6 o'clock. In that case, time to go home. [Manager] Hamjji, let's take a look at the research from the meeting sometime tomorrow! [Hamster] Yes! (Automatic reflex) In that case.. overtime. Choo.. (Chant of resignation) Ugh.. my eyes are strained. No matter what, I'm leaving at 9 PM. [Clock sound] Really.. I'm all done now. Save! [Error sound] ...? Ah! Hey! Ah! Don't fuck with me!!! Don't fuck with me!!!!!! Don't fuck with me!!!! ... It's.. all over.. Owari.. No, no. Get a grip!!!!!!!!!! Hold on!!!!!!!!!! [Can opening sound, drinking sound] - The last save was 1 hour ago.. No matter how much the world tries to screw me over, I have to get it done. [Music] Hello.. [Colleague] Gasp. Hamjji... I heard you worked overtime yesterday? [Hamster] Ah, yes.. I had something to review with the manager today.. [Colleague] Huh?! The manager is on annual leave today? You didn't know?

emotional_arc.text: Hope -> Shock -> Resignation -> Despair -> Renewed Determination -> Ironic Defeat

summary.text: The video opens with the protagonist, an anthropomorphic hamster named Kim Hamjji, hopefully calculating that they can leave work at 6 PM. This hope is immediately crushed when a manager's voice assigns a research task due the next day. The hamster's automatic, polite 'Yes!' response seals its fate, transitioning its thoughts from 'going home' to 'overtime'. This scene masterfully sets up the central conflict and relatable premise.
A series of rapid ECU shots of the hamster's face as it internally calculates its departure time, culminating in the hopeful conclusion of '퇴근' (going home).

notes: The extreme close-up on the hamster's face maximizes the anthropomorphic effect, making its expressions highly readable and endearing.
The rapid cuts between slightly different angles of the face create a sense of active thought and calculation.

keyframes.description: ECU of hamster looking slightly to the left, appearing thoughtful.
Slight zoom-in, hamster's eyes are wide and looking forward, conveying a moment of realization.
The hamster's eyes gleam with hope as the subtitle '퇴근' (going home) appears, representing the peak of its optimism.
The hamster's expression remains hopeful, just before the interruption.

summary.text: The manager's voice interrupts, assigning the new task. The shot cuts to the hamster wearing headphones, its hopeful expression instantly vanishing, replaced by shock and then a reflexive, defeated agreement.

notes: The addition of the large headphones (AirPods Max) adds to the 'office worker' persona and comedic scale.
The hamster's eyes, wide with shock, become the focal point, perfectly conveying the crushing of its hopes.

keyframes.description: CU of the hamster, now wearing large silver headphones. Its eyes are wide with shock upon hearing the manager's voice.
The hamster's expression is frozen in a state of disbelief.
A quick ECU as the hamster blurts out '넵! (자동 반사)' - 'Yes! (Automatic reflex)'. The eyes are still wide, showing the disconnect between its will and its conditioned response.
The hamster's eyes droop slightly in resignation as it processes the new reality of overtime.

audio_events.description: Deeper manager voice: '햄찌씨, 회의에서 나온 리서치 건 내일 중으로 한번 보자!'

summary.text: Resigned to its fate, the hamster begins the overtime grind. It mutters to itself, vowing to finish by 9 PM. A harsh cut to a digital clock reveals it is already 10:50 PM, humorously highlighting the character's failed ambition. The scene concludes with the hamster seemingly finishing its work, a moment of false triumph before the impending disaster.
The hamster, looking exhausted, works at its desk. It rubs its eyes and makes a solemn vow to leave by 9 PM, set against a backdrop of a darkening city.

notes: A montage of shots showing the hamster's fatigue (rubbing eyes) and determination (focused typing) builds empathy.
The transition to the city view shot provides scale and emphasizes the late hour.

keyframes.description: ECU of the hamster rubbing its face with its tiny paws in exhaustion.
CU of the hamster with headphones on, eyes narrowed in concentration, resigned to its fate.
A wide shot of a city highway at dusk, seen from an office window, as the hamster's voiceover makes its vow.
The hamster's voiceover concludes with '퇴근한다' (I will leave work).

audio_events.description: Determined hamster voiceover: '무슨 일이 있어도 9시엔 퇴근한다.'

summary.text: A hard cut to a digital clock showing 10:50 PM serves as a punchline, followed by the hamster looking utterly drained but declaring its work finished and moving to save it.

notes: The use of an insert shot of the clock is a classic comedic device to show the passage of time and subvert the character's goal.
The hamster's paw reaching for the laptop trackpad builds anticipation for the 'save' action.

keyframes.description: MS of a black digital clock on a wall, its red numbers starkly displaying '10:50 PM'.
CU of the hamster, looking completely exhausted, with the subtitle '(기절 일보 직전)' meaning 'on the verge of fainting'.
The hamster's paw moves decisively over the laptop trackpad as it says '저장!' (Save!).
The shot focuses on the laptop as the save action is initiated.

audio_events.description: A sharp, definitive 'tick' sound effect accompanying the clock reveal.

summary.text: The story's primary climax and turning point. The hamster's attempt to save its work results in a catastrophic error message and the dreaded 'spinning wheel of death'. This triggers a full-blown, profanity-laced meltdown. After hitting rock bottom, the hamster rallies itself, chugs an energy drink, and finds a second wind, resolving to redo the work with renewed, caffeine-fueled intensity.
The laptop screen displays an error message. The hamster stares in disbelief, which quickly turns to panic and a frantic, screaming outburst as the spinning rainbow wheel appears.

notes: The quick cuts between the error screen and the hamster's face create a frantic, panicked rhythm.
A rapid zoom-in (crash zoom) on the hamster's face during the scream emphasizes its raw emotion.

keyframes.description: Insert shot of a laptop screen showing a presentation titled 'Corp Research' with an 'Error' dialog box.
CU of the hamster's face, eyes wide with confusion and dawning horror.
The error dialog box is replaced by the macOS spinning rainbow cursor (the 'wheel of death'), the ultimate symbol of a system crash.
ECU crash zoom on the hamster's open mouth as it screams 'ㅈㅣ랄하지마!!!' (Don't fuck with me!!!).

summary.text: The hamster collapses in despair, but then fights to regain its composure, grabbing an energy drink as a last resort. It chugs the drink, and a visual effect signifies its energy being restored.

notes: The use of slow-motion and reverb on the voice ('모오와리' - It's over) effectively conveys the sense of despair.
The quick cut to the energy drink and the satisfying sound design of the can opening and gulping provide a clear narrative turning point.

keyframes.description: The hamster slumps back in its chair, defeated. Its voiceover, with heavy reverb, says '다.. 끝이다..' (It's.. all over..).
The hamster shakes its head, slapping its own face to 'wake up' while shouting '정신차렷!' (Get a grip!).
The hamster grabs a can of 'SOL' energy drink. The can opening is a sharp, pivotal moment.
A stylized visual effect of blue and white light radiates from the hamster's eyes as it finishes the drink, signifying a power-up.

audio_events.description: Loud, crisp sound of a soda can tab being pulled.

summary.text: Re-energized, the hamster returns to its laptop with intense focus, typing furiously. The voiceover reveals a grim new resolve to finish the work no matter what.

notes: The low angle shot makes the small hamster appear more determined and formidable.
The rapid typing animation conveys a sense of urgency and renewed productivity.

keyframes.description: CU of the hamster's determined face, eyes glowing slightly from the energy drink's effect.
Shot of the hamster's paws typing furiously on the keyboard.
A slow dolly-in on the hamster's face as it stares intently at the screen, fully focused on its task.
The hamster gives a slight, determined nod as the scene fades to black.

audio_events.description: Very fast, frantic keyboard typing sounds.
Determined hamster voiceover: '세상이 암만 억까해도 결국 해내야 한다.'

summary.text: The final scene serves as the punchline. The next morning, the exhausted hamster arrives at the office. A well-meaning colleague expresses sympathy for the hamster working overtime, then casually reveals that the manager who assigned the task is on annual leave. The hamster freezes, its eyes wide with the horrifying realization that its all-night struggle was for nothing. This ironic twist provides a final, darkly comedic gut punch.
A conversation between the protagonist hamster and a human colleague. The colleague's dialogue reveals the crucial, ironic information, leading to the hamster's silent, horrified reaction.

notes: The scene uses a shot-reverse-shot structure, cutting between the human colleague and the hamster's reaction.
The final shot is an extreme close-up on the hamster's eyes, which slowly lose focus, perfectly conveying its soul-crushing realization without any dialogue.

keyframes.description: CU of the hamster, looking tired but carrying a small backpack, arriving at its desk.
MS of a female human colleague speaking sympathetically to the hamster.
The colleague covers her mouth in shock as she says, '오늘 팀장님 연차인데?' (The manager is on annual leave today?). This is the moment of revelation.
Extreme close-up on the hamster's wide, unblinking eyes. A subtle zoom-in emphasizes its complete and utter shock as the video ends.

audio_events.description: Soft, gentle, slightly melancholic background music begins.
A faint, hollow wind sound effect to underscore the hamster's empty feeling.

visual: A silver laptop with a glowing Apple logo is clearly visible.
The text 'Macbook Pro' is visible below the screen at 18.5s.
The hamster is consistently shown wearing large, silver over-ear headphones identifiable as Apple AirPods Max.
A silver beverage can with a prominent red logo that reads 'SOL' is shown. This appears to be a fictional or generic brand for the video's purpose.
The hamster is holding a miniature blue backpack with a logo that strongly resembles the Jansport brand logo.
The black, ergonomic office chair used by the hamster and the colleague has design features characteristic of high-end Herman Miller models like the Aeron or Sayl.

ocr_texts.translation_en: A common starting point for an office worker's overtime hell
I heard you worked overtime yesterday??
